data.title: No Author, Author at PCWorld
data.meta_description: Read expert opinions by No Author at Pcworld.com
data.text:
Firefox 4 Tip: Put the Reload Button Back Where It Belongs

If you don't like the new location of the Reload button in Firefox 4, it's surprisingly easy to relocate it. Just drag and drop.

Yahoo Introduces Search Direct to Speed up Query Resolution

Yahoo has started beta testing a search feature that displays answers to queries and links to websites on the fly as people type their queries.

Microsoft Updates Bing for Mobile Browsers

Microsoft on Wednesday rolled out some updates to its Bing for Mobile browser service including real-time public transportation updates for select cities and the...

Connect Local Data to the Cloud with Box.net

Box.net and EntropySoft introduced ECM Cloud Connect to let customers seamlessly straddle the line between local and cloud data storage.

Hung: Dead Island Game Logo Censored by ESRB

Art depicting a man hung from a tree altered after Entertainment Software Review Board flunks Deep Silver marketing game logo.

GetJar Survey Shows Android Trumping The iPhone

Survey results gauge consumer sentiments towards apps and in-app ads

EU Puts Standardization at Forefront of Cloud Computing

The European Commissioner in charge of Europe’s digital program has put interoperability and standards at the forefront of the cloud computing agenda.

Dell Reaching Out to Fix PCs With Faulty Intel Chipset

Dell on Wednesday said it will start reaching out directly to affected customers to replace motherboards in PCs with Intel's flawed Sandy Bridge chipset.

India’s Securities Regulator Tightening Use of Internet

India’s securities regulator proposes tightening rules for Internet access by brokerages

Intel’s McAfee Unit to Acquire Sentrigo

Intel's McAfee subsidiary on Wednesday said it would acquire Sentrigo, which provides database security and compliance products.

Radiation Detector Robot Deployed in Fukushima

More help to prevent the radiation crisis at the Fukushima power plant from getting worse has arrived, but not in human form.

Windows Intune Provides Compelling Value

Microsoft's cloud-based Windows Intune service delivers simplified Windows PC management with cost-savings that are hard to ignore.

The New York Times’ Paywall Headaches Mount

The New York Times may have a hard time preventing committed freeloaders from breaking down its paywall.

Motorola Mobility to Buy Swedish IPTV Vendor Dreampark

Motorola Mobility has signed an agreement to acquire Dreampark, a Swedish IPTV software provider, the company said on Wednesday.

SCADA Vulnerabilities Prompt US Government Warning

A flurry of software vulnerabilities found in a variety of industrial control systems has prompted vendors to begin developing patches, following a warning by...

Best Buy to Resell LightSquared 4G Service

Satellite-LTE startup LightSquared has made a deal for national electronics retailer Best Buy to resell its service, LightSquared CEO and Chairman Sanjiv Ahuja...

Microsoft Intune Goes Live

After a year long beta, Microsoft's Intune hosted desktop management service is now fully operational

Speculation Over Amazon Android Tablet Mounts

Analysts are taking note of Amazon's battle with Apple, noting that Amazon could create a tablet that would give the iPad a run for its money.
